import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react" import { Link } from "react-router-dom" import styles from "../../scss/projects.module.scss" import bettle from "../../assets/bettle-hero.jpg" import bar from "../../assets/bar.jpg" import final from "../../assets/final.jpg" const Bettle = () => { const [contentHeight, setContentHeight] = useState(0) useEffect(() => { //nav 140px + 100 margin top setContentHeight(window.innerHeight - 200 - 18) }, contentHeight) return (
Autonomous Robot
This project was undertaken by Hersh Nevgi & Ping Song between late November '17 to early February '18 at the Monash sensilab, under the supervision of Jon McCormack and Elliott Wilson.
We've produced three robots each encased in a decorative shell that was designed and 3D-printed here in the lab. We built off the software written by Kim Alford, Andrew Barnhill and other students who've worked on this project previously, while we removed, added, and re-purposed existing components on the chassis of the Pololu m3pi robots. These robots are now equipped with:
  • 3 x VL6180x time-of-flight sensors, for obstacle avoidance
  • 1 x ISL29125 colour sensor, for line sensing (presence and colour)
  • 1 x SG90 servo motor, as part of a pen-lifting mechanism
The outcome
I started exploring the Global Trend of Ecommerce Fashion Industry. As known as the digital innovation, rising globalisation, and changes in consumer spending habits have totally changed the fashion industry into a new era. The dataset were categorised into different age group form 0-20 to 80-90.
This graph indicate the overall purchasing count of the dataset. As we can see the highest bar cross all age group is product "TOP".
) } export default Bettle
